properties.name: advantage
properties.sdo_desc: It should be made clear in which situations the Protocol has been successfully employed.

properties.name: limitation
properties.sdo_desc: It should be made clear in which situations the Protocol would be unreliable or otherwise unsuccessful.

properties.name: applicability
properties.sdo_desc: Applications of the protocol list the full diversity of the applications of the method and support if is possible to extend the range of applications of the protocol. e.g. northern blot assays, sequencing, etc.

properties.name: reagent
properties.sdo_desc: Reagents participating in the list. ChEBI and PubChem entities can be used whenever available. Commercial names are also acceptable (URL if possible)

properties.name: purpose
properties.sdo_desc: A goal towards an action is taken. Can be concrete or abstract.

properties.name: outcome
properties.sdo_desc: outcome or expected result by a protocol execution.

properties.name: identifier
properties.sdo_desc: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

properties.name: citation
properties.sdo_desc: A citation or reference to a creative work, such as a publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

properties.name: license
properties.sdo_desc: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

properties.name: isBasedOn
properties.sdo_desc: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html. Supersedes isBasedOnUrl.

properties.name: category
properties.sdo_desc: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

properties.name: isMentionedIn
properties.sdo_desc:
CretiveWork, Dataset, collection mentioning this entity

Inverse of:mentions

properties.name: device
properties.sdo_desc:
Device required to run the application. Used in cases where a specific make/model is required to run the application.

For LabProtocols it would be a laboratory equipment.

properties.name: actionApplication
properties.sdo_desc: An application that can complete the request.

properties.name: duration
properties.sdo_desc: The time it takes to actually carry on the protocol, in ISO 8601 duration format.
